basics.name: Andrea Murillo Martinez
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Electrical Engineering in the Electrophysiscs Track at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Monitor and facilitate lab equipment to students
highlights: Supervise and help students use 3D printers, SolidWorks, laser cut machine, soldering, etc.
Create video tutorials for lab equipment. www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iy-yWE2cuiU

work.summary: Intern in Silicon Valley working with the Operations Team at SiTime
highlights: Developed a python app for a seamless integration between Data Drive, SQL databases, and FTP servers, reducing manual effort and increasing data accuracy.
Automated wafer pickmap retrieval and transfer by navigating Data Drive directories and efficiently uploading files to OSAT FTP servers or local storage, streamlining data management workflows.

Enhanced operational productivity by implementing new features such as error-handling mechanisms, data validation processes, and optimized file transfer protocols, reducing production time and minimizing human error.

work.company: Engineering Council at the University of Hawaii at Manoa
work.summary: ECUH is an organization composed of engineering students whose main purpose is to represent the students of the College of Engineering
highlights: Help organize events for the College of Engineering and manage website for students to find new student groups.
Attend regional conference with other councils and talk about new improvements.

work.position: PACE Leader - Calvin Shindo Student Venture Fund
work.summary: Work with a team for due diligence of startup companies withing the University
highlights: Collaborated with a cross-functional team to evaluate early-stage startups, conducting due diligence to assess product viability, technical innovation, and market potential.
Gained experience in venture capital processes, including financial modeling, market research, and investment strategy, while developing a deeper understanding of the tech startup ecosystem.

volunteer.summary: Teach English to elementary and middle school kids.
highlights: Create study plan for students to learn english

awards.title: Honolulu Tech Week Hackathon
awards.summary: Created MopedSafe, an app for making sure moped is not stolen. Used an Arduino Nano microcontroller for detecting movement on the moped. Won 2 awards wiht a total value of $2000: Peoples Choice Award, Best Hardware Project.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to those students who maintain at least a 3.5 GPA

awards.title: Breakthrough Innovation Challenge
awards.summary: Pitched a business idea for $1000 funding.
